intro: Alepyrum viride, commonly known as green alepyrum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to parts of Asia, including China, India, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Alepyrum viride is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
